verses.text: Then Samuel took a vial of oil, and poured \add it\add* upon his head, and kissed him, and said, \add Is it\add* not because the \sc Lord\sc* hath anointed thee to be captain over his inheritance?

When thou art departed from me to day, then thou shalt find two men by Rachel’s sepulchre in the border of Benjamin at Zelzah; and they will say unto thee, The asses which thou wentest to seek are found: and lo, thy father hath left the care of the asses, and sorroweth for you, saying, What shall I do for my son?

Then shalt thou go on forward from thence, and thou shalt come to the plain of Tabor, and there shall meet thee three men going up to God \add to\add* Beth-el, one carrying three kids, and another carrying three loaves of bread, and another carrying a bottle of wine:
and they will salute thee, and give thee two \add loaves\add* of bread; which thou shalt receive of their hands.

After that thou shalt come to the hill of God, where \add is\add* the garrison of the Philistines: and it shall come to pass, when thou art come thither \add to\add* the city, that thou shalt meet a company of prophets coming down from the high place with a psaltery, and a tabret, and a pipe, and a harp, before them; and they shall prophesy:
and the spirit of the \sc Lord\sc* will come upon thee, and thou shalt prophesy with them, and shalt be turned into another man.
And let it be, when these signs are come unto thee, \add that\add* thou do as occasion serve thee; for God \add is\add* with thee.

And thou shalt go down before me \add to\add* Gilgal; and behold, I will come down unto thee, to offer burnt offerings, \add and\add* to sacrifice sacrifices of peace offerings: seven days shalt thou tarry, till I come to thee, and shew thee what thou shalt do.
And it was \add so\add*, that when he had turned his back to go from Samuel, God gave him another heart: and all those signs came to pass that day.
And when they came thither to the hill, behold, a company of prophets met him; and the spirit of God came upon him, and he prophesied among them.

And it came to pass, when all that knew him beforetime saw that behold, he prophesied among the prophets, then the people said one to another, What \add is\add* this \add that\add* is come unto the son of Kish? \add Is\add* Saul also among the prophets?
And one of the same place answered and said, But who \add is\add* their father? Therefore it became a proverb, \add Is\add* Saul also among the prophets?
And when he had made an end of prophesying, he came \add to\add* the high place.
And Saul’s uncle said unto him and to his servant, Whither went ye? And he said, To seek the asses: and when we saw that \add they were\add* no where, we came to Samuel.
And Saul’s uncle said, Tell me, I pray thee, what Samuel said unto you.
And Saul said unto his uncle, He told us plainly that the asses were found. But of the matter of the kingdom, whereof Samuel spake, he told him not.
And Samuel called the people together unto the \sc Lord\sc* \add to\add* Mizpeh;

and said unto the children of Israel, Thus saith the \sc Lord\sc* God of Israel, I brought up Israel out of Egypt, and delivered you out of the hand of the Egyptians, and out of the hand of all kingdoms, \add and\add* of them that oppressed you:

and ye have \add this\add* day rejected your God, who himself saved you out of all your adversities and your tribulations; and ye have said unto him, \add Nay\add*, but set a king over us. Now therefore present yourselves before the \sc Lord\sc* by your tribes, and by your thousands.
And when Samuel had caused all the tribes of Israel to come near, the tribe of Benjamin was taken.
When he had caused the tribe of Benjamin to come near by their families, the family of Matri was taken, and Saul the son of Kish was taken: and when they sought him, he could not be found.
Therefore they inquired of the \sc Lord\sc* further, if the man should yet come thither. And the \sc Lord\sc* answered, Behold, he hath hid himself among the stuff.
And they ran and fetched him thence: and when he stood among the people, he was higher than any of the people from his shoulders and upward.
And Samuel said to all the people, See ye him whom the \sc Lord\sc* hath chosen, that \add there is\add* none like him among all the people? And all the people shouted, and said, God save the king.
Then Samuel told the people the manner of the kingdom, and wrote \add it\add* in a book, and laid \add it\add* up before the \sc Lord\sc*. And Samuel sent all the people away, every man to his house.
And Saul also went home to Gibeah; and there went with him a band of men, whose hearts God had touched.
But the children of Belial said, How shall this \add man\add* save us? And they despised him, and brought him no presents. But he held his peace.
